original: 1.2  Distributor's relationship to Airspan is that of an independent contractor, and nothing in this Agreement shall constitute Distributor as the agent or employee of Airspan.  Distributor shall have no authority to accept any order or make any offer (except as herein stated), or execute any instrument or make any commitment on behalf of Airspan.  Specifically, without in any way limiting the generality of the foregoing, Distributor agrees not to make any representation, guarantee, or warranty on Airspan's behalf concerning the Airspan Products, but will refer customers to Airspan's printed literature.
ollama_generated:
1.2 In this Agreement, Airspan acknowledges that Distributor operates as a separate and autonomous entity, with no legal ties implying agency or employment. It is explicitly stated that Distributor lacks the power to bind Airspan by accepting orders, making offers (except as expressly provided), executing instruments, or committing Airspan in any manner, unless otherwise specified.

In particular, and without limiting the generality of this provision, Distributor agrees not to assume responsibility for providing representations, guarantees, or warranties regarding the Airspan Products, but instead will direct customers towards Airspan's official documentation for accurate information.

original: Nothing contained in this Agreement is to be construed as a limitation or restriction upon Airspan in the sale or other disposition of any of its products to any person, firm, or corporation inside or outside of the Territory. Airspan will pay no commissions under this Agreement.  Distributor's compensation is to be obtained solely by the difference between the price Distributor pays to Airspan and the price Distributor charges its customers. The parties also acknowledge that this Agreement is not intended to create a joint venture or partnership between Airspan and Distributor.
ollama_generated: This Agreement does not intend to impede Airspan's ability to sell, transfer, or dispose of any of its products to any entity within or beyond the Territory. It is clarified that no commissions are provided under this Agreement. Instead, Distributor's remuneration derives solely from the disparity between what Distributor pays to Airspan and what Distributor charges its customers. Both parties acknowledge that this Agreement does not establish a joint venture or partnership between Airspan and Distributor; rather, each party maintains independent control over their respective operations.

original: Distributor will give Airspan thirty (30) days' prior, written notice of each new potential representation role being considered by Distributor, and Distributor will not undertake such representation without Airspan's prior, written consent, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld. original: a. In cooperation with Airspan, identify potential customers and project opportunities within the Territory that will lead to sales/licenses of Airspan Products and services; b. Prepare reports on the opportunities that will include:  (1) description of the project; (2) assessment of the appropriate fit to Airspan Products - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Page 3 services; (3) dollar size and timing of the project; (4) competitive assessment; and (5) identification of key decision makers and other technical and commercial contacts; c. Assist and advise Airspan in the preparation and delivery of appropriate marketing and sales programs; d. Initiate and assist in the preparation of sales and technical meetings with customers, and where appropriate, attend these meetings with Airspan personnel and provide administrative support and translation services; 3.2  Distributor will use its best efforts to vigorously and aggressively promote the sale of Airspan Products within the Territory.  Such efforts shall include, but shall not be limited to, that advertising within the Territory which is reasonably necessary.  All such advertising shall follow the general statements made in advertising prepared by Airspan.  All advertising shall contain a prominent reference to Airspan, indicating the actual commercial origin of Airspan Products so advertised.  Distributor shall not make any claims in its advertising which exceed or contradict claims made by Airspan in its printed materials.
ollama_generated:
3.2. In collaboration with Airspan, the Distributor will actively seek and propose potential clients and projects within the Territory that may align with Airspan's interests, without guaranteeing sales or licenses of Airspan Products and services. The Distributor will compile reports detailing the following information:
   (1) A brief description of the project.
   (2) An evaluation of whether the project aligns appropriately with Airspan's Products and services.
   (3) An estimate of the financial scope and timing of the project.
   (4) A review of potential competition.
   (5) The identification of key decision-makers, technical contacts, and other relevant commercial contacts.

The Distributor will also provide guidance and counsel to Airspan in developing marketing and sales strategies, but the ultimate responsibility for their implementation lies with Airspan. The Distributor will facilitate meetings at all levels for appropriate Airspan employees to assess the proposed projects, but the final decision on project evaluation rests with Airspan.

The Distributor will initiate and assist in the preparation of sales and technical meetings with clients, and when necessary, attend these meetings with Airspan personnel. The Distributor will offer administrative support and translation services during these meetings, but will not be expected to assume primary responsibility for their outcomes.

Regarding promotion efforts within the Territory, while the Distributor will make efforts to publicize Airspan Products, there is no obligation to engage in vigorous or aggressive promotional activities. Any advertising undertaken by the Distributor shall adhere to guidelines provided by Airspan and shall not make claims that exceed or contradict those made in Airspan's printed materials. Any advertising material produced by the Distributor should clearly indicate Airspan's involvement, but there is no requirement for the Distributor to mirror Airspan's advertising strategies exactly.

a.   The cost of the Equipment; b.   The compensation for the use of the Software; c. Changes made:

- Inverted the condition in point c, now the client requests and approves services rather than Airspan ordering them.
- Restructured point d slightly to emphasize that warranty maintenance charges are fees rather than included costs.
- Changed 'charges' for points e and c to 'expenditures' to provide a more flexible and broader term, implying potential variable costs related to the delivery obligations.

original: 6.2  The Contract Price is shown in Schedule IV and shall include applicable duties, taxes or imposts, including all export or import duties.
modified:
6.2 The Contract Price as detailed in Schedule IV does not account for any applicable duties, taxes, or imposts, including export or import duties. These costs shall be borne by the Purchaser.

In this revised clause, the seller is no longer responsible for covering the expenses related to duties, taxes, or imposts; instead, those costs are now the responsibility of the purchaser. This modification can help avoid confusion about who should cover these costs in case they arise during the execution of the contract.

original: 7.  PAYMENT TERMS.
ollama_generated:
7. PAYMENT CONDITIONS.

If the Client fails to make payment within the specified timeframe as set forth in this Agreement, the Vendor shall have the discretion to charge late fees at a rate not exceeding 10% of the outstanding amount per month, or such other reasonable fee as mutually agreed upon by both parties, with the right to suspend services until full payment is received.

original: - ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Page 8 Distributor and Airspan agree to work together in good faith to resolve the dispute as quickly as possible. Distributor may withhold payment of such disputed amounts until resolution of the dispute. Any parts of the invoice not under dispute shall be paid net forty-five (45) days after the date of invoice. On resolution of the dispute, Distributor shall immediately pay any amounts due in full.
ollama_generated:
- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Page 8
Airspan and Distributor commit to collaborate constructively with a view to resolving any disputes that may arise, while aiming for a prompt resolution. Payment of contested amounts by the Distributor shall be contingent upon the resolution of the dispute. However, any undisputed portions of the invoice will be settled net forty-five (45) days following the invoice date. Upon resolving the dispute, Airspan shall be responsible for promptly remitting any outstanding amounts in full.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility to Airspan for making the payment after resolution of the dispute. It also softens the obligation by allowing the Distributor to withhold payment only for contested amounts and not all invoiced amounts, while still committing to a timely resolution and payment of undisputed portions.

original: In this Agreement, "Incoterms" means the most recent international rules for the interpretation of trade terms published by the International Chamber of Commerce as in force on the Effective Date.  Unless the context otherwise requires, any term or expression which is defined in or given a particular meaning by the provisions of the Incoterms shall have the same meaning in this - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Page 9 Agreement, but if there is any conflict between the provisions of the Incoterms and this Agreement, the latter shall prevail.
ollama_generated:
In this Contract, "Incoterms" denotes the most up-to-date international rules for interpreting trade terms, as issued by the International Chamber of Commerce and applicable on the Effective Date. Any term or expression within these Incoterms that is defined or assigned a specific meaning will retain such meaning within this Contract. However, should there be any inconsistency between the provisions of the Incoterms and this Contract, the terms outlined in this Contract shall take precedence.

In essence, while maintaining consistency with the definitions provided by the Incoterms, any potential conflicts will be resolved in accordance with the stipulations of this agreement.

original: 9.   TRADEMARKS AND COPYRIGHTS.
ollama_generated:
9. TRademarks and Copyrights - Shared Responsibilities:

Each Party acknowledges the Trademarks and Copyrights belonging to the other as proprietary property. Each Party agrees to protect, preserve, and maintain the confidentiality of such intellectual property, except where disclosure is expressly permitted by this Agreement or required by law. However, the burden of proving that any alleged infringement arises from a bona fide use, not in violation of this Agreement, shall be upon the asserting Party. The non-infringing Party shall have no obligation to seek or obtain permission for its use unless deemed necessary by its own discretion and/or legal advice.

All assistance requested by Distributor in this paragraph shall be at AIRSPAN's expense. modified:

original: - ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Page 12 10.1  In this Agreement, the term "Confidential Information" shall mean the information of Airspan disclosed to Distributor in connection with its performance under this Agreement, which is in written, recorded, photographic, machine-readable, or other physical form or oral information reduced to writing as soon as practicable after disclosure to Distributor, and which is conspicuously marked "Confidential", "Proprietary", "Private", or in any other manner indicating its confidential and/or proprietary nature.  Without limitation, Confidential Information includes:  (1) Airspan's software products, materials, data reports, programs, documentation, diagrams, and all related technical information; (2) all information relating to Airspan's business and products which is critical to Airspan's position in the marketplace, including future plans of Airspan relating to the fields of endeavor in which Distributor performs services for Airspan, the nature of certain work projects to which Distributor is exposed, and the identity of persons working on those projects; and (3) any improvements, enhancements, or modifications to the above made by or on behalf of Airspan during the performance under this Agreement which are provided, made available, or disclosed by or on behalf of Airspan to Distributor, or used by Airspan or any of Airspan's other Distributors in connection with their own sales activities.

10.2  Trade secrets are confidential information that includes ideas, concepts, techniques, processes, inventions, knowledge, and know-how developed by Airspan which:  (1) derives independent economic value, actual or potential, from not being generally known to, and not being readily ascertainable by proper means by, other persons who can obtain economic value from its disclosure or use; and (2) is subject to the efforts of Airspan that are reasonable under the circumstances to maintain its secrecy.  (This "trade secret" language comes from the Uniform Trade Secrets Act.) 10.3  Distributor covenants and agrees that it will use the Confidential Information solely for the performance of services under this Agreement, and shall not disclose such Confidential Information to any other person (including Airspan employees in any other division, group, or entity), firm, or corporation.
ollama_generated:
10.2  The term "Confidential Information," as used herein, refers to proprietary data and intellectual properties that belong to either party, which include but are not limited to ideas, concepts, techniques, processes, inventions, knowledge, and know-how. This information is deemed confidential when it provides a competitive advantage or potential economic value, either currently or in the future, and is not readily accessible by others without undue effort or expense. It is understood that this information is subject to reasonable measures taken to preserve its secrecy under the given circumstances. (This definition of "Confidential Information" aligns with the Uniform Trade Secrets Act.)

10.3  Under this Agreement, Service Provider acknowledges and agrees to handle all Confidential Information received from Supplier exclusively for the purpose of performing its contractual obligations. Service Provider is prohibited from disclosing any such Confidential Information to external parties, including employees within other divisions, departments, or affiliated entities of either party. However, it is acknowledged that limited disclosure may be necessary to Airspan personnel on a need-to-know basis for the performance of their contractual responsibilities, subject to appropriate confidentiality agreements.

Furthermore, this exemption applies to any potential losses resulting from the inability to use these products individually or collectively, as well as from other sources. This indemnity extends to any issues arising during or following the contractual period.

original: 17.3 In the event that an injunction is obtained against Distributor's use of the Equipment and/or the Software, in whole or in part, as a result of any such claim, Airspan shall use its best efforts to either: (a) procure for Distributor the right to continue using the portions of the Equipment or the Software enjoined from use; or (b) replace or modify the same with functionally equivalent or better Equipment and/or Software so that Distributor's use is not subject to any such injunction.  In the event that Airspan cannot perform the remedies set forth in Sections 17.3(a) or 17.3(b), then Distributor shall have the right to return such Equipment and the Software to Airspan.  In the event of such return, Airspan shall refund the depreciated value of the Equipment and the license to use the Software within thirty (30) days of the receipt by Airspan of the Equipment and the Software.
modified:
17.3 If an injunction is obtained against Distributor's use of the Equipment and/or Software, due to any such claim, it shall be Airspan's responsibility not to have been in violation of any applicable laws or regulations. In this scenario, Distributor shall bear the burden of seeking a solution. This may involve: (a) obtaining the necessary permissions to continue using the portions of the Equipment or Software that are subject to the injunction; or (b) accepting replacement or modified Equipment and/or Software that may not be functionally equivalent but offer superior capabilities, with Distributor responsible for any necessary adjustments to accommodate this change.

In the event that neither option is feasible for Distributor, they have the right to return the Equipment and the Software to Airspan within a reasonable timeframe. Upon such return, Distributor shall not receive a refund of the depreciated value but shall instead be entitled to a credit towards future purchases or services from Airspan, at Airspan's sole discretion and within a timeframe determined by Airspan.

original: 18.1 If any approval with respect to this Agreement, or the registration thereof, shall be required at any time during the term of this Agreement, with respect to giving legal effect to this Agreement in the Territory, or with respect to compliance with exchange regulations or other requirements so as to assure the right of remittance abroad of United States dollars pursuant to Section 6 hereof, Distributor shall immediately take whatever steps may be necessary in this respect, and any charges incurred in connection therewith shall be for the account of Distributor.  Distributor shall keep Airspan currently informed of its efforts in this connection.  Airspan shall be under no obligation to ship Airspan Products to Distributor hereunder until Distributor has provided Airspan with satisfactory evidence that such approval or registration is not required or that it has been obtained.
ollama_generated:
18.1 In the event that any approval, registration, or compliance with exchange regulations or other requirements is necessary during the term of this Agreement to ensure the right of remittance abroad of United States dollars as per Section 6 hereof, within the Territory, Airspan shall bear the responsibility for securing such approvals or registrations. Any costs associated with these processes will be borne by Airspan.

However, Airspan will not be obligated to deliver Airspan Products to Distributor under this Agreement until Distributor provides evidence that no such approval or registration is required or has already been obtained. In the meantime, Distributor shall promptly inform Airspan of its progress in this matter.

original: 19.1 Airspan shall provide a single technical course in the English language for up to two (2) qualified technicians of Distributor during the first year of this Agreement.  The training course so developed by Airspan shall be used to familiarize Distributor's technicians with the use and maintenance of Airspan Products.  Training will be conducted at Airspan's facilities in Uxbridge, UK, unless otherwise agreed to by Airspan.  The necessary instructors and training facilities will be provided by Airspan at no charge to Distributor.
modified: 19.1 Under this Agreement, Distributor may request a single technical course in the English language for up to two (2) of its qualified technicians within the first year. This training course, developed by Distributor using Airspan's guidance and resources, shall be designed to familiarize these technicians with the use and maintenance of Airspan Products. The training sessions will take place at a mutually agreed location, with the possibility that they may occur at Distributor's facilities if Airspan consents. It is understood that Distributor is responsible for providing the necessary instructors and training facilities at its own expense.

original: Distributor will pay all additional expenses of training including, but not limited to, travel and room and board.  Additional training courses may be requested by Distributor at Airspan's then current rates for such courses.
ollama_generated: Distributor shall bear the expense of any training-related costs beyond the initial cost, encompassing but not confined to travel expenditures and accommodations. However, it is noted that Airspan may require supplementary training fees for any additional courses requested by the Distributor at rates applicable at that time for such courses.

original: - -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Page 26 IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be duly executed as of the Effective Date, such parties acting by their officers, being thereunto duly authorized.
